title: Highest government expenditure per primary student
description: In 2015, Serbia had the highest government expenditure per primary student, amounting to 43.65% of GDP per capita.

title: Most women making informed decisions about reproductive health
description: In 2019, 96.2% of women aged 15-49 in Serbia made their own informed decisions regarding sexual relations, contraceptive use, and reproductive health care, the highest percentage globally.

title: Lowest multidimensional poverty rate
description: In 2019, Serbia had one of the lowest multidimensional poverty headcount ratios, with only 0.1% of the population affected.

title: Lowest net bilateral aid from Finland
description: In 2022, Serbia received the lowest net bilateral aid flows from Finland, amounting to -$4,099,999.90.

title: Lowest net official flows from UNECE
description: In 2015, Serbia had the lowest net official flows from UN agencies, specifically UNECE, with a value of -$961.99.
